creator: brettroesner
title: M333
description: This project is a hands-on visual activity designed to help students learn about the solar system by creating their own model using Styrofoam balls, dowel rods, and paint. Students will decorate the Styrofoam balls to represent the sun, planets, and other celestial bodies, and then connect them using the dowel rods.
steps: Decide on a theme for the solar system model, incorporating new interests, current events, or personal experiences.
Begin painting the largest Styrofoam ball to represent the "sun."
Allow the "sun" to dry completely, then start painting the first planet.
Let the first planet dry, and then paint the second planet.
Repeat the drying and painting process for all the remaining planets.
Insert a dowel rod into each planet and connect the other end to the "sun," arranging the planets around the sun to create a solar system model.
